Unknown.translation: Just as a town has many shops which are visited by many customers who go there to buy or sell their merchandise.

lines.gurmukhi: jwpY kCu bycY Aru bnju n mwgY pwvY; Awn pY ibswhY jwie dyKY suK nYn kau [

Unknown.translation: When a customer who has sold something at a shop is unable to buy something from there since it is not available, he visits other shops. Finding his requirements there, he feels happy and relaxed.

lines.gurmukhi: jw kI hwt skl smgRI pwvY Aau ibkwvY; bycq ibswhq cwhq icq cYn kau [

Unknown.translation: A shopkeeper who keeps all types of commodities in his shop and which are sold frequently, a customer generally likes to sell or purchase from there. He feels happy and satisfied.

lines.gurmukhi: Awn dyv syv jwih siqgur pUry swh; srb inDwn jw kY lYn Aru dYn kau [454[

Unknown.translation: Similarly, if a follower of other god comes to the refuge of the perfect True Guru, he will find that his store-house is filled with all types of trading commodities (of loving worship).  (454)
